column4: is it even possible to start a script after connecting to a wireless internet connection? or do i have to manually write a script for it that detects the connection?
putting a script in /etc/network/if-up.d/ might do it, not sure
afaik those are executed when the device powers up, so it probably isn't connected at that point
I was under the impression the scripts were run as soon as a network connection was established, feel free to try it out
